label: logicA:astronomy_en
steps: [1] If a star is on the main sequence, then it is fusing hydrogen in its core.
[2] If a star is fusing hydrogen in its core, then it emits a relatively stable luminosity.
[3] For every object x, if x is an exoplanet, then x orbits a star.
[5] The Sun is on the main sequence.
[6] The Sun is fusing hydrogen in its core (from [1] and [5]).
[7] The Sun emits a relatively stable luminosity (from [2] and [6]).
[9] The Sun emits a relatively stable luminosity and Kepler-186f orbits a star (from [7] and [8]).
